title: Program coupon message still appears on MM learner dashboard
body: ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Log in as a user with a program coupon (see, for example, [ZenDesk 145658](https://odl.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/145658)) 2. Load the learner dashboard ### Expected Behavior - Since e-commerce is no longer possible on micromasters, I don't expect to see any mention of coupons on the dashboard ### Actual Behavior - I see the message "Courses in this program are free, because of your coupon." at the top of my dashboard ### Screenshot or Screencast

title: User that's paid for a run but not enrolled end up on order page
body:
This is happening because the logic in `CourseAction` redirects the user to the order summary page if they have a coupon regardless of whether they've already paid for the course or not.

### Steps to Reproduce

- Create a `UserCoupon` for a user
- Attempt to enroll in a course run when edx/devstack is unreachable in order to have enrollment not be created (Order will still be created)
- Attempt to subsequently enroll in the run

### Expected Behavior
- User gets a popup dialog to enroll in the course run

### Actual Behavior
- User ends up on the order summary page

title: Only update the dashboard if the current user is the same as the dashboard being loaded
body: Staff can view learner profiles, which causes the learner's dashboard to be loaded (`/api/v0/dashboard/USERNAME/`). This works fine most of the time, but if the learner's edX auth credentials are invalid it can cause the staff user to get [logged out](https://github.com/mitodl/micromasters/blob/master/static/js/lib/api.js#L61).

title: Login prompt doesn't appear if a course run doesn't have enrollment_end set
body: Current enrollments query doesn't account for null enrollment_end dates, the query here doesn't take into account null values, a null `enrollment_end` should be considered infinite future: https://github.com/mitodl/micromasters/blob/master/courses/models.py#L200

title: APIs with learner username are returning a 404 for MITx Online users
body: Some usernames that are possible on MITx Online contain characters that aren't currently being matched by the url regex, resulting in a 404 and a visible error message to the learner.

title: New program enrollment / backend login prompts incorrectly
body:
### Steps to Reproduce
If you're a learner in a program with mitx online auth, the dialog will prompt you to login with edx even if it has historical runs on that platform.

### Expected Behavior

The UI should only prompt you to login if there are enrollable runs on a given platform.

title: Financial aid submissions: loses search_query when paging through results
body:
### Steps to Reproduce

- Access financial aid review page, e.g. /financial_aid/review/2/ 
- Type a search term (e.g. `an`) and click the magnifying glass
- Note how many pages of results are returned
- Click `>` to advance to the next page of results

### Expected Behavior

- User would be taken to the 2nd page of returned results filtered by the search term

### Actual Behavior

- User is taken to the 2nd page of all results. It is no longer filtered by `search_query`. You can confirm by noting that the number of pages is larger than after the search filter was applied (the `y` in  `Page [x] of [y]`)
- Note that the `search_query` querystring parameter is removed from the URL when you click `>` or `<`
- I believe the code is here:

https://github.com/mitodl/micromasters/blob/88db6b61fb2335aaef2dd5c43041923a197e3fa9/financialaid/templates/review_financial_aid.html#L80-L95)


### Screenshot or Screencast

https://www.screencast.com/t/bUBXzapSseaa - Provided by customer support

title: MITx Online: link in dashboard always says "View on edX"
body: This should be conditional on the `courseware_backend` for the latest run and say "View on MITx Online" for that backend.

title: MITx Online: Learner doesn't get prompted to login/signup if adding a new program
body:
The learner should get prompted to login with the program if they now need an auth they don't have. This can happen if they enroll in a new program or if they are already enrolled and the program moves to MITx Online.

> If I have no account with either backends and I register with mitxonline I can see my dashboard fine. But it never asks me to register with edx, even when I switch to a different program, is that going to be a problem?

title: Update all cache types in update_cache_for_backend
body:
#### What are the relevant tickets?
Related to the recent changes in adding cache for mitxonline backend

#### What's this PR do?
This fixes a bug in the release #5030

#### How should this be manually tested?
Create an account for edx or use an existing account.
When you signup for mitxonline your cache should be fresh and you should not see an error message that data is not fresh on the dashboard.

title: User with grades from multiple platforms causes errors
body:
See https://sentry.io/organizations/mit-office-of-digital-learning/issues/2591400782/?project=104497&query=is%3Aunresolved

The problem here is that it's been assumed that the username coming back in edx data will always match `User.username` and that's not always going to be the case going forward, in fact it's likely to be the rule not the exception.

title: Fix promise rejection with non-error exception
body:
We're seeing an error `Non-Error exception captured with keys: detail, errorStatusCode`: https://sentry.io/organizations/mit-office-of-digital-learning/issues/991823545/?project=104497

It's probably being caused by this line rejecting a promise with a non-Error object:
https://github.com/mitodl/micromasters/blob/5d07dac5715ac11cc261727c75d2035709601307/static/js/actions/coupons.js#L32

The fix is to replace this with `Promise.reject(new Error("Unable to attach coupon"))` or something like that.

title: Linking to FAQ should display the answer
body:
As a member of the customer support team, I'd like to be able to give users a direct URL to answer a FAQ, such as https://micromasters.mit.edu/dedp/frequently-asked-questions/#how-can-i-edit-my-personal-information.

When the user opens that link, the page scrolls to display the question, but the answer is not displayed. The user still needs to click the question to see the answer. 

I would like have the answer displayed automatically to avoid any user confusion.

Right now commendation letters are only generated if `MicromastersCourseCertificate` objects exist. Those objects only exist for FA programs, and we want commendation letters for non-FA programs.

title: Misleading final grade search results
body:
The way enrollments are serialized [here](https://github.com/mitodl/micromasters/blob/master/dashboard/serializers.py#L17) only the first found paid course run enrollment is serialized and indexed, and that is the course run grade and semester that will show up in the search results.

It looks like for the final grade facet we should pick the best final grade the learner earned for the course.

See https://odl.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/14406 It's possible this will already be fixed by https://github.com/mitodl/micromasters/pull/3802 which hasn't released yet. Also, this may be affected by the fact that the CFx course has "Should display progress" set to False.

title: "Skip and Pay Full Price" error
body:
### Steps to Reproduce (on CI and in production)

1. Delete or reset the learner's financial aid object. 
2. Click "Pay Full Price" on the dashboard, and again on the confirmation dialog

### Expected Behavior

- The learner's dashboard is updated with the full price: $1000

### Actual Behavior

- The learner gets a toast message "Failed to Skip Financial Aid"
- However, it appears that it actually succeeded"
  - the API returns a 200 (with no content)
  - the learner's financial aid object has a status of "skipped" 
  - reloading the browser restores the dashboard to the expected state

title: Dashboard: 'Auditing' and 'Audited' are not the only options
body: When a learner has paid for a course, but not yet passed or failed, we can't display `auditing` or `audited` in the grade pop-up Here's a case that shows the issue, from [ZenDesk #13770](https://odl.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/13770) Here's the code where the options are passed, failed, `auditing` or `audited` https://github.com/mitodl/micromasters/blob/aed8753e1dac52f9cd53d1186491bc73e6e5e000/static/js/components/dashboard/courses/GradeDetailPopup.js#L47-L58 If we can't think of a better option, I think `paid` would be acceptable.

title: Don't create a RedeemedCoupon unless the coupon actually changed the price
body:
We use an automated coupon for the $50 fixed discount for learners who paid for a verified certificate on edX prior to 2017. For the users who qualify for this coupon, they are getting a RedeemedCoupon for every purchase, even when the coupon isn't (and shouldn't be) applied. 

We should only create a RedeemedCoupon when the coupon is actually applied and it affects the total_price_paid.

title: DoesNotExist: UserSocialAuth matching query does not exist.
body:
We get multiple `DoesNotExist: UserSocialAuth matching query does not exist.` errors every six hours. Most of these errors are related to superusers on the CI and RC servers, but there is also at least one user in production. 

Since these users don't have an edX SocialAuth, we shouldn't even attempt to update their edX cache. Although I am curious about that one user in production, I don't see a lot of value is raising an exception every six hours for that user. Presumably, if they have a successful log in to micromasters.mit.edu the issue should clear. 

https://sentry.io/mit-office-of-digital-learning/micromasters/issues/193071074/

title: Course certificates don't consider exam run grade availability date
body:
For courses that are exam-enabled, `MicromastersCourseCertificate`s are created for users that have a passing `FinalGrade`, a passing `ProctoredExamGrade`, and don't yet have the certificate. This logic needs to be changed such that the certificate is created only if the passing `ProctoredExamGrade` has an associated `ExamRun` with a `date_grades_available` in the past. 

Task to generate course certificates: `grades.tasks.generate_course_certificates_for_fa_students`

title: Automatic coupon is being incorrectly marked as already redeemed
body:
Automatic coupons do not have limits on how many other people can redeem them, but due to an incorrect filter this check wasn't done. This would prevent the coupon from being redeemable by a user if another user had already redeemed that coupon
See also https://odl.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/10358

title: Dashboard: clicking "exam grade" displays "edX grade" info
body:
### Steps to reproduce: 

1. Load a user dashboard or a user profile that includes an exam grade
2. Click on "exam grade" for any course

### Expected Behavior

A modal card is displayed with all of the users exam grades. 

### Actual behavior

A modal card is displayed with the learner's edX course grades (same result as clicking on "edX grade")

### background

The dashboard should always display the best exam grade, but learners who have taken an exam multiple times may want to be able to see all their attempts. Staff may also need to see the full exam history of a learner when they view their profile page. Clicking on "exam grade" to display the full history of exam grades is a way to see the complete history.

title: automatic email editing is broken
body:
There's a problem on master with editing automatic emails on `/automaticemails`. If you attempt to edit an email and save it this happens:

![tasdfasdfasdfasdf](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6207644/27591275-298b0be6-5b1f-11e7-9488-5a950a692df5.png)

the problem is that the email ID isn't being passed in to the function which figures out the URL to issue the PATCH request for, so we end up PATCH-ing `/api/v0/mail/automatic_email/undefined`, which obviously doesn't correspond to a record we can update.

the bug was introduced in this PR: https://github.com/mitodl/micromasters/pull/3238

title: ProctoredExamGrade.exam_run is not being set
body:
This is required for grades to show up in the dashboard. We need to set it on the record when we process EXAM files and then write a migration to backpopulate the data. We shouldn't encounter a data race between the code deploy and migration because we're not currently processing grade responses.

- [ ] In `exams.pearson.download.ArchivedResponseProcessor.process_exam_file` ([link](https://github.com/mitodl/micromasters/blob/master/exams/pearson/download.py#L323-L332)) we should set `ProtoredExamGrade.exam_run` to the value of `exam_authorization.exam_run`.
- [ ] Then write a migration to populate the `exam_run` for existing `ProtectedExamGrade` records that don't have a value in that column. The correct `ExamRun` can be found by the query `ExamAuthorization.objects.get(id=peg.client_authorization_id).exam_run`.

title: Mail: receiving multiple percolate emails when only updating profile once
body:
Locally I'm randomly receiving multiple copies of percolate-triggered emails. It ends up resulting in the below stacktrace. I discussed this with @noisecapella and suggested these changes as options to reduce the duplicates:

#### To have a "at least once" guarantee of mail sending:

- Create `SentAutomaticEmail` with status = pending
- Create transaction
- Use `select_for_update()` to acquire row-level lock on `SentAutomaticEmail` created above
- Send email to Mailgun
- Update `SentAutomaticEmail` status = sent
- Commit transaction

#### To have a "at most once" guarantee of mail sending:

- Create `SentAutomaticEmail` with status = pending
- Create transaction
- Use `select_for_update()` to acquire row-level lock on `SentAutomaticEmail` created above
- Update `SentAutomaticEmail` status = sent
- Commit transaction
- Send email to Mailgun

cc @pdpinch, probably a product decision which type of guarantee of send we want.

```

celery_1    |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/site-packages/django/db/backends/utils.py", line 64, in execute
celery_1    |     return self.cursor.execute(sql, params)
```

Update
---
On further testing, this appears to caused by one `index_users` tasks being triggered for each `Profile`, `Employment`, and `Education` record a user has (see the `post_save` signals in search/signals.py) because we `PATCH` the entire profile structure including the nested `Education` and `Employment` records when we update any of that data and DRF correctly re-saves the data (often with no change) and triggers the `post_save` signal for each record, causing a race condition. After discussing with George, we both agreed we shouldn't change the signals, but instead go ahead with one of the options I described above.

title: Dashboard: course_paid_on_edx should not be equivalent to having paid for a FA course
body:
From [ZenDesk 6882](https://odl.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/6882)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a FA course. 
2. Create a user with a fake enrollment in the FA course
3. Fake a verified certificate for the user in the FA course (optional)
3. Create a final grade for the user with `course_paid_on_edx=True`
(Steps 2-4 are equivalent to running `manage.py alter_date set_to_passed`)

### Expected Behavior:

When viewing the learner's dashboard (or when viewing their profile as staff), the course should not display as paid. The learner still needs to upgrade to the FA course price. 

(optional: When the learner does upgrade, they should get an automatic $50 coupon, since they have a certificate)

### Actual behavior:

When viewing the learner's dashboard, the course displays as paid. The learner can't upgrade.

title: Search: Degree facet counts users once for each degree

milestone.title: Animal Crackers
milestone.description: National Animal Crackers Day is April 18th.

body:
To reproduce:

- As a staff user, go to the search page. Pick a degree type and note the count.
- As a learner user, go to your profile and add a degree of that type.
- As a staff user, note that the count for that degree has gone up by 1 as expected.
- As a learner user, go to your profile and add another degree of that same type.
- As a staff user, note that the count for that degree has gone up by 1 again, which it shouldn't.

This crux of this issue is that the education history is being indexed as nested documents and so the aggregation is counting the number of nested documents (education objects) not the number of top-level objects we index (analogous to users).

title: Final Grades: change django cache backed to have async process work consistently

Currently the grades apis use the default django cache to save the status of a grading freeze process, but the cache is currently working per process and cannot be read across processes.

We should define an additional cache backend (redis) to be used currently only by the grades api.

This is necessary to run the grade freezing properly in production

title: Database models have fields that aren't timezone-specific
body:
We're still getting a load of django timezone warnings, particularly if we run something that heavily involves the database, eg: the `seed_db` command. A lot of these warnings are likely due to a misunderstanding of python `datetime`. `TimestampedModel` is inherited by a lot of our models, and it uses the following as its queryset:

```python
class TimestampedModelQuerySet(QuerySet):
    """
    Subclassed QuerySet for TimestampedModelManager
    """
    def update(self, **kwargs):
        """
        Automatically update updated_on timestamp when .update(). This is because .update()
        does not go through .save(), thus will not auto_now, because it happens on the
        database level without loading objects into memory.
        """
        if "updated_on" not in kwargs:
            kwargs["updated_on"] = datetime.datetime.utcnow()
        return super().update(**kwargs)
```

`datetime.datetime.utcnow()` does NOT yield a timezone-sensitive datetime. This should be changed to `datetime.datetime.now(pytz.utc)`, and all other examples in the codebase should be changed accordingly. This can be considered done when we can run `seed_db` with no timezone warnings

title: checkout API returns 500 error when course missing edX course key
body:
This is another one of those errors that should never happen -- it only did because I was testing and I set an enrollment start date in the past for a course run with no course key. 

I'm not sure it's worth fixing, but if it ever did happen in the wild, it would be a better UX to display an error to the user that encourages them to contact us, and log an `ImproperlyConfigured` exception instead of a causing a 500. 

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a course run in a FA program with an enrollment start date in the past, but no course key
2. Calculate your personalized price and click the "Pay Now" button

### Expected results

Learner is directed to Cybersource for checkout

### Actual results

The API returns a 500, but nothing happens in the browser. 

A traceback appears in the logs, something like this: 

```
2016-11-27T19:57:40.340816+00:00 app[web.1]: An exception was intercepted by custom_exception_handler
2016-11-27T19:57:40.340820+00:00 app[web.1]: Traceback (most recent call last):
2016-11-27T19:57:40.340821+00:00 app[web.1]:   File "/app/.heroku/python/lib/python3.5/site-packages/rest_framework/views.py", line 474, in dispatch
2016-11-27T19:57:40.340822+00:00 app[web.1]:     response = handler(request, *args, **kwargs)
2016-11-27T19:57:40.340822+00:00 app[web.1]:   File "./ecommerce/views.py", line 58, in post
2016-11-27T19:57:40.340823+00:00 app[web.1]:     edx_course_key=course_id,
```

title: Can't reset a learner's financial aid without setting income, currency, etc.
body:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. As a learner, chose "Skip this an pay full price" This will set your financial aid status to skipped. 
2. As an admin, edit the learner's financial aid and change the status to "reset"
3. Click save.

### Expected behavior

Learner's status is changed

### Actual behavior

Income, Original Income, Original Currency and Country of Income are required fields and cannot be saved without a value. 

### Workaround

Use dummy values. Once the financial aid is saved with the reset status, if the learner applies again a new financial aid object will be created.

title: Updating profile photo (avatar) in Safari results in 400 error from Profile API
body:
I'm not sure when this regression was introduced. It seems to be broken in production, -rc and -ci.

Steps to reproduce (tested in Safari):

1. Log in
2. Go to https://micromasters-rc.herokuapp.com/learner 
3. Click Camera icon to upload an image
4. Choose image (drag and drop or file dialog)
5. Click Save

### Expected Behavior

Profile photo updates with uploaded image

### Actual behavior

Same photo still there. Profile API returns a 400 error

 We should test to make sure that it works as expected in PR #1858

title: Undefined context variables referenced in templates
body:
The base template relies on a number of context variables for conditionally rendering different content. There are a number of pages where those variables are not provided and so the template renderer throws an exception. This makes for very noisy log messages which make it difficult to identify legitimate errors. We should ensure that if a variable is needed in the template context that it is provided, even if it is for a falsey value.

Example stacktrace:

Program average grade in search results will not work for FA programs
body: The calculation of grades in FA programs is different from non-FA programs, and the serialization of average grades for search results was never updated to account for this. Code can be found in dashboard/serializers.py

title: Course Status Enrollment Date doesn't match data
body:
Not sure if this is the same issue as #1612  -- (that was Start date and this involves Enrollment begins date).

Ran the following query:
python manage.py alter_data --action=course_info --email='jtausig@mit.edu' --program-title='Chain' --course-title='Fundamental'

Which returned:
"course_runs": [
    {
      "edx_course_key": "course-v1:MITx+CTL.SC1x_3+1T2017",
      "start_date": null,
      "id": 62,
      "enrollment_start": "01/01/2030",
      "end_date": null
    },
    {
      "enrollment_end": "05/10/2016",
      "edx_course_key": "course-v1:MITx+CTL.SC1x_2+1T2016",
      "start_date": "02/10/2016",
      "id": 61,
      "enrollment_start": "02/10/2016",
      "end_date": "05/10/2016"
    },
    {
      "enrollment_end": "08/28/2015",
      "edx_course_key": "course-v1:MITx+CTL.SC1x_1+2T2015",
      "start_date": "05/20/2015",
      "id": 14,
      "enrollment_start": "05/20/2015",
      "end_date": "08/28/2015"
    },
    {
      "enrollment_end": "12/24/2014",
      "edx_course_key": "course-v1:MITx+ESD.SCM1x+3T2014",
      "start_date": "09/24/2014",
      "id": 60,
      "enrollment_start": "09/24/2014",
      "end_date": "12/24/2014"
    },
    {
      "edx_course_key": "MITx/ESD.SCM1x/3T2014",
      "start_date": "09/24/2014",
      "id": 17,
      "enrollment_start": "09/24/2014",
      "end_date": "12/24/2014"
    }
  ],
  "course_title": "Supply Chain Fundamentals"
}

That suggests an enrollment begins date of 1/1/2030, but on rc, we are displaying an enrollment begins date of 12/31/2029.
(screenshot below)

Additionally, there is no start date, yet we are showing a fuzzy date of January 2017 -- where is that coming from?

![enroll future fuzzy start](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13886722/19891888/870a0d84-a018-11e6-8851-c84d13796db4.PNG)

title: Move Error Message on the Upload a Profile Photo Pop-up
body:
If a user tries to upload a non-image file to their Profile, we are displaying error messaging to the user, but
because the pop-up window is so large, unless they scroll to the bottom of the window the user never sees the error message.

Suggest that we either shrink the size of the window or handle the error messaging differently.

Steps to reproduce:
Log into MicroMasters
Create a profile on edX
Go to the first profile tab and click on the camera icon at the top.
Click on the pop-up, change the file type to "all files" and chose a non-image file to upload.
First screen shot shows the non-scrolled error message:  you will see that the error message is not displayed.
![non image photo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13886722/19452677/ec6da2f2-947f-11e6-8421-7f683f05c925.PNG)

Second screen shot shows the same window, scrolled to the bottom so the error message is visible.
![non image photo scrolled to error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13886722/19452705/096d132e-9480-11e6-8438-7a307f5b6995.PNG)

title: Scroll function not working on popups with Edge & IE 11
body:
On the profile page, for any of the pop-ups that are spawned (Preferred Language, Country, State) in Edge & IE11, if no value is selected, clicking on either the slider or the up/down arrow closes the window rather than navigates through the list of values.

Steps to Reproduce:
Log into MicroMasters using either Edge & IE11.
Create a Profile on edX.
On the first Profile Tab, click on one of the following fields:
Preferred Language, Country or State.
If NO value is populated in that field,  note that in the pop-up window if you click
on either the slider or the up/down arrow, the window is closed.
(if the field is populated with a value, then those navigation elements work)

Expected Behavior:
Navigation elements should allow the user to scroll up or down the list.

This IS working in Firefox & Chrome.

title: Tab order incorrect on first Profile Tab
body:
Steps to Reproduce:
Log onto MicroMasters.
Create a Profile on edX.
Select the Program field.
Navigate to the next field (Given Name) using the Tab.

Expected Behavior:
One Tab click should bring the user to the Given Name Field.
Actual Behavior:
It takes 3 Tab clicks to navigate to the Given Name Field.
Additionally, if a user is on the Given Name field and attempts to tab back up to the Program Field, that action does not work at all.

NOTE:  The transition between those 2 fields has an issue, all the other fields on the first Profile Tab look good.

title: Birthdate year validation on the Profile Page is incorrect
body:
A user can enter a value for their date of birth year ranging from 1800-2100.
Steps to reproduce:
Log onto MicroMasters.
Create a new edX profile.
On the first profile page, tab down (or mouse) to the Date of Birth Field.
For the Year value if a user enters "1111" the value changes to "1800"
(or you can manually enter 1800).
Similarly, a user can enter a value greater than 2017 all the way up 2100.
(or you can enter "5555" which reverts to "2100")
![1800](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13886722/19402360/bc187350-922e-11e6-8afc-756435e75858.PNG)
![210](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13886722/19402367/c650d876-922e-11e6-8c65-fb1f47b6cb29.PNG)

title: Failed mailgun calls result in exception raised instead of returning a response with proper formatting
body: The calls made to mailgun in `mail.api.MailgunClient` don't actually return json if there is an error, so the calls to `mail.views` when there is an error will actually raise an exception due to `response.json()`.

title: Use calculated income not original income for determining tier

milestone.title: Dessert Day
milestone.description: Last day before our beta release

body:
## Steps to reproduce
1. Click on Calculate Your Cost
2. Enter 100000 for income and Albanie Lek for currency. (equivalent to about $813/yr in USD)
3. Click Submit
## Expected Result

Lowest-price tier: $100 per course
## Actual Result

Highest-price tier: $1000 per course

I suspect the issue is that we're using `original_income` instead of `income_usd` for calculating the tier. 

See https://github.com/mitodl/micromasters/blob/master/financialaid/serializers.py#L70

title: Submitting cost calculation with error response has no UX change
body:
Spawned from #1282 for handling after MVP

The most likely scenario is submitting a not-supported currency.
#1275 handles general syncing of frontend-supported and backend-supported currency codes, but there may be a rare case where a learner may end up submitting a code that isn't supported.

The learner should get some sort of message when errors come up when they click calculate cost, perhaps directing them to the helpdesk or telling them to refresh the page and try again.

title: (Possible bug) Logic for fetching enroll-able CourseRuns may be incorrect
body:
from courses/models.py:146

``` python
    def get_active_enrollment_queryset():
        """
        Returns a Q object that encapsulates the logic for filtering for CourseRun objects
        that are active for enrollment.
        """
        now = datetime.now(pytz.utc)
        return (
            # there is only the start date
            (models.Q(enrollment_end=None) &
             models.Q(end_date=None) & models.Q(start_date__lte=now)) |
            # there is no enrollment date but the course has not ended yet
            (models.Q(enrollment_end=None) & models.Q(end_date__gte=now)) |
            # the enrollment end date is simply greater than now
            models.Q(enrollment_end__gte=now)
        )
```

If a CourseRun has a start_date in the future (lets say 5 days from now) and no end_date or enrollment_end, that should probably be an enroll-able course, but this logic will exclude it

title: Error message on dashboard if no program enrollment is available
body:
After completing the sign-up process on a new MicroMasters installation, the user is redirected to the dashboard, where they see an ugly error message:
![Error message: No program enrollment is available.](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/132355/18647184/e092682c-7e82-11e6-9bf5-522b77c744a5.png)

Expected: if the user tries to view the dashboard without a program enrollment, they are shown a friendly message explaining that they cannot proceed further without an enrollment, and no enrollments are available. Another option is to automatically redirect the user someplace they can go, with an informative message on that page explaining why they were redirected. (These messages are known as "flash messages" in Rails and Flask, not sure if there's an equivalent in Django.)

title: Sign-up page: greeting doesn't dynamically change name correctly
body: The sign-up page at `/profile/` has a nice feature where the greeting will dynamically change as the user types. However, it doesn't do so _correctly_, which leads to a confusing user experience. # Actual behavior When the user first visits the page, the greeting contains the first part of their email address, like so: However, after the user enters their given and family names, only the family name appears: After the user types in their preferred name, the given name is updated with their preferred name, but the family name still appears: # Expected behavior When the user first visits the page, the greeting should contain the first part of their email address. The application does this correctly. When the user types in any text into the "given name" and "family name" fields, they should _both_ override the email address fragment. If the user types "First" into the given name file and "Last" into the family name field, the result should be "First Last" in the greeting. When the user types any text into the "Preferred name" field, that should override all other fields. If the user types "Preferred" into this field, the result should be "Preferred" in the greeting (not "Preferred Last").

title: Select field - poor performance on country select field
body:
Easiest way to observe:
1. Click on a country select (eg: the one under 'Currently Living' in the Personal tab)
2. Hold the down arrow to rapidly navigate through the options

**Result:** The suggestions menu effectively freezes for several seconds. During this time, the escape key has no effect, and the menu stays in the same position within the browser window as you scroll up/down on the page

Another way to observe:
1. Type a single letter that many countries share as their first letter (C, F, S, etc.)
2. Hit backspace after typing the letter and immediately type a different letter that many countries share 
3. Repeat a few times in quick succession (eg: 'C', backspace, 'F', backspace, 'S', backspace, 'C')

**Result:** The suggestions menu and the input field are very slow to update

This is almost definitely due to the relatively large number of options and the burden of DOM updates. For the fields of study select, we mitigated this by preventing the suggestions menu on blank input and limiting the number of suggestion matches. We might consider doing something similar here. We might also want to consider some kind of load-ahead solution (ie: only load N suggestions to start out, and load the next N as the user navigates down through the list)

title: Select field - odd filtering behavior after options have been selected
body:
This involves a few different behaviors. We should center around one of these for consistency.
### To reproduce scenarios 1-3, start with these steps:
1. Focus on any select field (eg: the Country field under 'Currently Living' in the Personal profile tab)
2. Choose any autocompleted option (doesn't matter if you type anything, or if you hit enter/click to choose)

**Scenario 1**
1. Click the text input area again

Result: All options are presented as suggestions, not just the option you've already chosen

**Scenario 2**
1. Immediately after choosing, hit the down arrow to bring up suggestions

Result: Only the option you've already chosen is presented as a suggestion

**Scenario 3**
1. Click the text input area again
2. Hit the left arrow to move the text cursor back to the penultimate letter
3. Hit the right arrow to move the text cursor to the end of the text again

Result: Initially, all options are presented as suggestions. After moving the cursor, only the option you've already chosen is presented as a suggestion (even when it is moved back to the end of the text)
### Now here's the weird one...

**Scenario 4 (refresh the page before trying this)**
1. Focus on any select field
2. Click on one of the autocomplete options without typing anything 
3. Hit the down arrow to bring up autocomplete suggestions
4. Clear the field
5. Type in a couple letters to filter the autocomplete suggestions
6. Select one of those suggestions via enter key or mouse click
7. Hit the down arrow again to bring up autocomplete suggestions

Result: After hitting the down arrow the first time, all suggestions are presented. After the second time, only the option you've already chosen is presented as a suggestion
### Suggested fix

I'm inclined to say we should only present the already-chosen option as a suggestion under all circumstances, but we can certainly discuss this

title: User cannot login if an exception occurs early in the social auth pipeline
body:
I ran into a problem when the `update_profile_from_edx` function threw an Exception due to unrelated work I did. In this case the `User` is created but the user can't login using that user. When they next attempt to login a new user is generated with a new username which won't match the edX username. This will cause us to fail to get their profile information, which prevents them from logging in the second time.

To reproduce:
- Add a `raise Exception()` in `update_profile_from_edx`
- Delete your `User` or start from scratch with a new docker container
- Login and authorize with edX. You should get the exception you put in `update_profile_from_edx`
- Remove the exception you added in the first step
- Try to login again. This time you will get a different exception complaining about being forbidden from accessing the user profile REST API. If you look at the URL you will see that some characters are appended to the username. A new `User` was created for this login with a username that doesn't match edX, so future logins will always fail.

To solve, we can move our functions to the end of the social auth pipeline. At this point even if our code raises an exception, it won't prevent python-social-auth from linking edX to the account and they'll be able to login again with the same `User`
